business.headline: JP Morgan warns of 60% chance of global recession after Trump's tariffsFollowing the US-China trade war, global investment firm J.P. Morgan said it now sees a 60% chance of the global economy entering recession by year-end, up from 40% previously.

Wall Street shatters as Trump tariffs trigger worst day in US markets since 2020US markets suffered their steepest decline since 2020 after China retaliated against Trump's tariffs. The S&P 500 fell 6%, fuelling recession fears and intensifying investor anxiety across global markets.

Dow crashes 2,000 points as Trump's tariffs spark global market panicGlobal markets plunged as Trump's tariffs triggered a trade war escalation with China. The Dow fell over 2,000 points, crude prices tumbled, and investors feared an impending global recession.

Higher inflation, slower growth: US Federal Reserve chair warns after Trump tariffsUS Federal Reserve chair Jerome Powell spoke as global markets continued a swoon that has wiped some 10 per cent off major US stock indexes since Trump announced a raft of new tariffs on Wednesday.

US stocks plummet after China's retaliatory levies in response to Trump tariffsNasdaq IXIC dropped more than 20 per cent from its all-time closing high touched in December, putting it on course to confirm a bear market.
Income tax return 2025: ITR-2 filing now made easierITR-2 is meant for individuals whose annual income is above Rs 50 lakh or who earn from sources like rent, capital gains, or other sources.

Sensex tumbles over 900 points, Nifty ends below 23,000; IT, metal stocks crashThe S&P BSE Sensex tumbled 930.67 points to 75,364.69 at the closing bell, while the NSE Nifty50 tumbled 345.65 points to settle at 22,904.45.

IT stocks bleed as market crashes. Why TCS, Infosys, Wipro shares are down?All major IT stocks declined as fears of a US recession led to heavy selling. IT companies earn a large portion of their revenue from the US market, and concerns about a slowdown in technology spending have further weakened investor sentiment.

With 'fancy ice-cream' jab, Piyush Goyal's cold message to Shark Tank judgesPiyush Goyal row: While flagging the trend of Indian startups focusing on 'fancy ice creams' and food delivery apps, Piyush Goyal drew a parallel with China to pitch for more innovation in deep-tech.

RIL share price falls 4% ahead of Q4 results. Should you sell?Reliance Industries stock: RIL shares opened at Rs 1,240 and fell to an intraday low of Rs 1,192.85 in the afternoon session. The stock was close to its 52-week low of Rs 1,156, which it touched on March 3, 2025.

US tariffs stay at 26% as White House unveils new trade documentInitially, India's tariff rate was mentioned as 27% in the earlier version of the White House annex. However, the latest revision has adjusted it to 26%.

Withdrawing EPF? Know rules for marriage, education, home and medical needsIf you require money out of your EPF for the purposes of marriage or further studies, there are set regulations one needs to adhere to. You must have been an EPF member for at least seven years and must have at least Rs 1,000 in your EPF account.

Politicians need reality check, says Ashneer Grover on Piyush Goyal's startup remarkAshneer Grover has said that Indian politicians need a reality check after Piyush Goyal criticised startups for being too focused on food delivery apps.

Pension rules updates: 8 RBI guidelines every pensioner must knowIf a bank accidentally credits more pension than it should to a pensioner, then the bank must consult the Pension Sanctioning Authority before recovering the extra money.
Explained: Why Tata Motors share price has fallen 5% todayTata Motors share price: Tata Motors has gone down 8.68% in the last 5 days, 33.43% in the past month and 38.75% in the last year.

Piyush Goyal slams Indian startups, urges to shift focus from food delivery appsUnion Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal criticised India's startup ecosystem, saying it's too focused on food delivery, betting, and fantasy sports apps. In contrast, he praised Chinese startups for prioritising advanced tech like EVs, batteries, semiconductors, and AI, urging Indian innovators to shift toward deeper, tech-driven innovation.

Sensex crashes 1,000 points: 3 reasons behind today's stock market bloodbathStock market crash: The S&P BSE Sensex was down 965.90 points to 75,329.46, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 361.10 points to 22,889.00 as of 2:08 pm.

Storm of protest from startups after Minister Piyush Goyal's 'dukaandari' jibeStartup ecosystem leaders' response came after Piyush Goyal took a firm stance and said that while Indian startups were busy building food delivery platforms and fantasy gaming apps, those in countries like China were working on EVs, semiconductors, batteries, and AI.

Sensex tanks over 700 points as Wall Street bloodbath sinks Indian IT stocksStock market crash: The S&P BSE Sensex was down 698.89 points to 75,596.47 at around 10:06 am, while the NSE Nifty50 was trading 269.50 points lower at 22,980.60.

Trump's tariff jitters hit US stocks: Will Sensex, Nifty feel the heat today?The extensive tariff announcements by the US government have raised concerns about a global recession, leading to sharp losses in stock markets worldwide.

Stocks to watch on April 4: Shares in news; HDFC Bank, Zomato, DMartStocks in news today: In Friday's session, shares of Zomato, Nestle India, HDFC Bank, DMart, Mazagon Dock, Bajaj Finance, and others will be in focus due to key corporate developments and financial updates.

Dukaandari hi karni hai? Piyush Goyal slams startups stuck on food deliveryCommerce Minister Piyush Goyal asked Indian startups to shift their focus from food delivery apps to high-tech sectors like semiconductors and AI.

Trump tariff blitz wrecks Wall Street, markets suffer biggest fall since CovidTrump's sweeping tariffs sent shockwaves through financial markets, with Wall Street suffering its worst decline since 2020. Analysts warn of economic slowdowns, surging inflation, and a potential recession.

US tech, retail stocks lead rout after Trump's tariff blowTrump's broad tariffs send US markets into a tailspin, with tech, retail, and banking stocks plunging. Apple, Walmart, and Nike face rising costs, while energy prices drop amid economic concerns.

Wall Street opens sharply lower amid trade war fears after Trump tariffsWall Street's major indexes fell sharply after President Trump's new tariffs raised trade war fears. The Dow dropped 2.66%, the S&P 500 declined 3.32%, and the Nasdaq plunged 4.50%, reflecting market uncertainty.

Wall Street bleeds as Trump's tariffs stoke recession fears: 3 things to knowThe Dow Jones Industrial Index fell sharply by over 1,100 points, while the Nasdaq was down over 800 points moments after the US markets opened for trading.

PPF nomination updation now free, says Nirmala SitharamanIt is important to add a nominee to the PPFaccount so that the money is transferred in a smooth manner in the event of the death of the PPF account holder.

Trump's 'Liberation Day' tariff: India at 27%, but where does Pakistan stand?Asian nations have been the hardest hit by Trump's latest tariff move. The new duties aim to cut the US trade deficit and change global supply chains.
Sensex, Nifty snap 2-day winning streak as D-Street sees limited tariff impactThe S&P BSE Sensex fell 322.08 points to close at 76,295.36, while the NSE Nifty50 shed 82.25 points to end at 23,250.10.
Explained: How Trump's administration calculated reciprocal tariffsIn a statement released on Wednesday night, the United States Trade Representative (USTR) explained how the tariffs were determined.

Byju Raveendran alleges conspiracy caught on video amid legal woesThe video he shared is one minute and 44 seconds long and appears to be a screen recording of a virtual meeting involving Byju's shareholders and their lawyers.

Trump's tariff list: Here's why Asian countries took the biggest hitTrump tariff: Besides China, which now faces a total tariff of 54%, Vietnam has been hit with 46%, Thailand with 37%, South Korea with 25%, and India with 27%.

Trump's tariff order: India gets key exemptions on several critical mineralsTrump's new tariff order exempts India on copper, lumber, and critical minerals. The order imposes a 26% lower tariff on India compared to China, but experts question the calculation methods. Former diplomat Ashok Sajjanar criticises the non-transparent system and highlights the impact on strategic partnerships in the Indo-Pacific region.

Mixed bag, not a setback: India's first response to Trump's tariffThe Commerce Ministry of India is analysing the impact of the 27% tariff imposed by the US. The ministry states it's a mixed bag and not a setback. Exemptions are expected in sectors like pharmaceuticals, semiconductors, and critical minerals. The tariff ranges from 10% to 27% across various sectors. India aims to sign a Bilateral Trade Agreement with the US by fall this year.

Sun Pharma, Gland, Cipla, Dr Reddy's: Why pharma stocks are rising todayShares of Sun Pharma, Dr Reddy's Laboratories, Gland Pharma, and Cipla rose sharply during early trade, defying the weak trend visible on the broader markets.
Trump tariffs roil Dalal Street: Sensex, Nifty fall as IT stocks worst hitThe S&P BSE Sensex fell 344.27 points to 76,273.17, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 80.60 points to 23,251.75 as of 9:31 am.

Why Russia, Canada and these countries were not part of Trump's tariff hit listThe exclusion has raised eyebrows, especially as major trade partners like India (27%), the European Union (20%), and Vietnam (46%) have been slapped with hefty duties. So, why were these countries spared?

Mixed bag, not setback: Government official on Trump's tariffs on IndiaThe new tariffs announced by US President Donald Trump include a universal 10% duty on all imports into the US starting from April 5, with an additional 16% to be applied from April 10.

Stock market opening on April 3: Will Sensex, Nifty fall after Trump tariff?The stock market extended its gains for the second consecutive session in its last session. The Sensex surged 592.93 points to close at 76,617.44, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 166.65 points to end at 23,332.35.

Stocks to watch on April 3: Shares in focus; Maruti Suzuki, Airtel, HDFC BankThe stock market will closely track developments today as several companies such as Maruti Suzuki, HDFC Bank, SpiceJet, and more remain in focus due to key announcements.

entertainment.headline: Laapataa Ladies writer Biplab Goswami denies plagiarism claims: Completely untrueBiplab Goswami, screenwriter of Laapataa Ladies, denied plagiarism allegations following online comparisons to Burqa City. He asserted the film's originality, citing years of research and screenplay registration since 2014.

Hrithik Roshan calls Jr NTR his favourite co-star: He's brilliant and amazingHrithik Roshan, during his Tour marking 25 years in Bollywood, called Jr NTR his favourite co-star. He also spoke about directing Krrish 4 and his desire to work with Christopher Nolan.

Mugdha Chaphekar, Ravish Desai announce separation after 9 years of marriageTV actors Mugdha Chaphekar and Ravish Desai have announced their separation after nine years of marriage. They have been living apart for over a year.

Travis Scott India Tour: Second show added in Delhi due to high demandTravis Scott is set to perform in India for the first time with his Circus Maximus Tour on October 18, 2025. Owing to a huge demand, a second show has also been added.
Chhaava on OTT: When and where to watch Vicky Kaushal's blockbuster filmVicky Kaushal's blockbuster Chhaava is gearing up for its digital release on Netflix, expected on April 11.

RRR stars Ram Charan, Jr NTR to reunite with director Rajamouli, but not for filmRam Charan and Jr NTR, stars of the blockbuster RRR, will join director SS Rajamouli and composer MM Keeravaani for a special Q&A session at London's Royal Albert Hall.

Teary-eyed Amitabh Bachchan attends Manoj Kumar's funeral with son AbhishekVeteran actor Manoj Kumar's last rites are being conducted in Juhu, Mumbai, with several celebrities, including Amitabh Bachchan, present to pay their respects.

Empuraan box office Day 9: Mohanlal film becomes highest-grossing Malayalam filmL2 Empuraan continues its impressive box office run, earning Rs 2.9 crore on its ninth day. With a total of Rs 91.15 crore in India and strong overseas earnings, it may become the highest-grossing Malayalam film.

Echoes of the past: Lost charm of Bollywood music, can the glory days be back?It has been a while since the Hindi film industry produced a full album which boasted some memorable tracks. So does this mean Bollywood music has lost its sheen? Artistes such as Lalit Pandit and Shabana Azmi weigh in.

Veteran actor Manoj Kumar to be cremated with state honours in MumbaiVeteran actor Manoj Kumar, known for his patriotic films, will be given a state funeral. The Bollywood fraternity and his family are set to bid him a final farewell, with his last rites scheduled in Juhu at 11:30 am.

Sikandar box office Day 6: Salman Khan film struggles, earns mere Rs 3.75 croreSalman Khan's latest film Sikandar, directed by AR Murugadoss, saw a significant drop at the box office on its sixth day despite a decent start. The film's total domestic collection now stands at Rs 94 crore after earning just Rs 3.75 crore on Day 6.

Jr NTR praises brother-in-law Nithin at MAD Square success bashMAD Square has been a hit among audiences, and Jr NTR couldn't be prouder of his brother-in-law Narne Nithin's acting journey. Speaking at the success bash on Friday, he reminisced about his initial reaction when Nithin first approached him to discuss his aspirations of becoming an actor.
The Last Five Years finally hits Broadway after years of anticipationNick Jonas and Adrienne Warren bring the beloved musical 'The Last Five Years' to Broadway for the first time.

Elizabeth Olsen admits Marvel films aren't her cup of tea: Not the art I consumeActor Elizabeth Olsen opened up about her personal film preferences and how they differ from her roles in the Marvel Cinematic Universe. Despite her pride in playing Wanda Maximoff, she shared the pressure to choose projects that reflect her true taste.
New sex trafficking charges filed against Sean 'Diddy' CombsSean Diddy Combs faces two additional sex trafficking charges, expanding the federal indictment against him.

Good Bad Ugly trailer: Ajith Kumar brings mass back in Adhik Ravichandran's nextThe much-anticipated trailer of Ajith Kumar's Good Bad Ugly is finally out. Directed by Adhik Ravichandran, the film is set to hit theatres on April 10.
James Cameron unveils Avatar Fire and Ash trailer at CinemaConJames Cameron unveiled his Avatar Fire and Ash movie's first trailer at CinemaCon introducing new Na'vi clans.

Actor-comedian Russell Brand charged with rapeRenowned actor and comedian Russell Brand has been charged with serious allegations of rape and sexual assault and oral rape. The alleged offences took place between 1999 and 2005.

Dan Da Dan Season 2: Release date, platform and how to watch it earlyDan Da Dan fans can rejoice as the release date for the second season has been announced, along with an opportunity to watch the first three episodes before the full season airs. The episodes will be available in theatres outside Japan under the title Dan Da Dan: Evil Eye.

general news.headline: Joining NDA cost JDU Muslim votes, Waqf bill support won't do any damageWhile Nitish Kumar, after severing ties with the NDA, gained a significant portion of Muslim votes in the 2014 Lok Sabha elections, data on the post-2015 scenario presents a different picture.

India, Sri Lanka sign 1st defence deal, six other pacts during PM Modi's visit  Live UpdatesIn a big announcement and relief to several fishermen from Tamil Nadu, PM Modi said that he had also raised their concerns and declared that Sri Lanka has agreed to the immediate release of any Indian fishermen and the prompt return of their boats.

Amid Waqf row, RSS report on land under Catholic churches gets Rahul Gandhi flakThe article on the website of the Organiser, which has now been unpublished, claimed that Catholic institutions hold 7 crore hectares of land, making them the largest non-governmental landowner.

A Kia cue for the BJPThe BJP's national showroom may be packed, but in states like Tamil Nadu, one-size-fits-all politics keep crashing. It's time for a branding revamp - same engine, different badge.

BookMyShow removes all content of comic Kunal Kamra amid joke row, delists himSoon after the online ticketing platform's decision to delete Kamra from the history list of artists, Shiv Sena (Shinde faction) youth leader Rahool N Kanal welcomed the move, thanking BookMyShow for removing any content linked to the artist.

Prajwal Revanna confined woman, raped her, filmed act: Police chargesheetThe chargesheet states that the Prajwal Revanna forcibly confined the woman, raped her multiple times, recorded the acts, and threatened her with dire consequences if she ever spoke about the assaults.

Market has spoken: China to US after Trump's tariffs jolt global marketsAs US President Donald Trump ramps up tariffs on Chinese goods, China fires back with equal retaliatory measures, asserting that "the market has spoken" amid global financial turmoil.

MS Dhoni's parents watch IPL game in Chennai for the first timeIPL 2025, CSK vs DC: MS Dhoni's parents, Pan Singh Dhoni and Devaki Devi, were present at Chepauk to watch the match between Chennai Super Kings (CSK) and Delhi Capitals (DC).

University of Bath School of Management: A Pathway to Global Career SuccessBath's School of Management blends top academics, hands-on learning, and career support to help students secure jobs at leading global companies.

Gossip can be good. Here's how to make it healthy (and harmless)Beyond its bad reputation, gossiping can also be positive and healthy. Psychologists call it 'social glue' that brings communities together. It is also deemed good for mental health (when it is harmless).

Lay down arms and join mainstream or face action: Amit Shah to NaxalsUnion Home Minister Amit Shah on Saturday urged Naxals to surrender and join the mainstream, reaffirming the government's resolve to end red terror in Chhattisgarh's Bastar by March 2026.

Why US has sent 'ghosts of the sky' to this remote island near IranThe massive deployment of one of the world's most advanced military aircraft, known as 'ghosts of the sky', just 2,400 miles from Iran's coastline, has only added to the tensions in the Middle East.

Cash row: Justice Varma takes oath as High Court judge, but won't get any workJustice Yashwant Varma, from whose residence a huge amount of unaccounted cash was recovered, will not be assigned any judicial work until the probe against him is ongoing.

Barack Obama gets candid amid divorce buzz: Was in deep deficit with MichelleRumours of a divorce between Barack Obama and Michelle have swirled for months. It gained traction after Barack Obama was seen without his wife at Donald Trump's inauguration.

Video: Woman drags mother-in-law by hair, beats up husband in GwaliorAccording to complainant Vishal Batra, his wife Neelika had been pressuring him for over a year to evict his 70-year-old mother, Sarla Batra, and send her to an old-age home.

Ghibli AI art vs real hand-drawn magic: Can tech match the heart of the originals?The Ghibli AI art trend has gone viral with people gushing over its lively creation and vibrant style, but fans of the original studio say it lacks soul. Can an AI-made filter really capture decades of emotional, hand-drawn animation? Where do we draw the line in honouring Ghibli's timeless artistry?

Do you also feel a small electric shock when touching someone? ExplainedFeeling a tiny electric shock when you touch a doorknob, a chair, or even another person? You're not alone; it happens to all of us now and then. That little jolt might be surprising, but it's not unusual. So, what causes this sudden spark? Let's break it down and understand the science behind it.

Rs 1.5 crore in cash seized during raids at Empuraan producer's chit fund officesThe searches are part of an ongoing investigation into alleged foreign exchange violations amounting to Rs 1,000 crore under the Foreign Exchange Management Act (FEMA).

Bill Gates revisits early days as Microsoft turns 50Microsoft turns 50 today and Bill Gates chose to celebrate the day with a memory down the lane. From his early days to building up Microsoft all captured in just a few photos. CEO Satya Nadella has also shared a video, featuring Gates and Copilot.

PM honoured with Sri Lanka's highest civilian award for boosting bilateral tiesThe Mithra Vibhushana medal, specially instituted to recognise extraordinary global friendships, reflects the deep and historic relationship between the two countries. The honour was conferred during Prime Minister Narendra Modi's maiden visit to Sri Lanka in his third term in office.

Pregnant Delhi woman claims Ola cab driver threatened to 'kill' unborn babyIn a post on LinkedIn, a pregnant woman from Delhi claimed that an Ola cab driver threatened to 'kill' her unborn baby when she asked him to turn on the air conditioner.

In Sri Lanka, PM urges immediate release of Tamil fishermen, their boatsRecurring arrests of fishermen from Tamil Nadu by Sri Lankan authorities have been a long-standing conflict between the two countries.

Khushdil Shah in ugly fan fight in NZ, PCB says anti-Pakistan slogans provoked himThe Pakistan Cricket Board defended Khushdil Shah, stating that the batter was provoked after hearing a group of spectators shouting abuse and anti-Pakistan slogans. In a chaotic scene at the Bay Oval in Mount Maunganui on Saturday, Khushdil was restrained by security personnel as he attempted to jump a fence and confront the fans.

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".
